user_story: As a developer, I want an autonomous test agent that writes tests, implements code, and verifies results, so that I can automate test-driven development workflows using local Qwen model.
acceptance_criteria: GIVEN a code file or requirement, WHEN the test agent is invoked, THEN it generates comprehensive test cases following pytest patterns
GIVEN test cases, WHEN the agent generates implementation code, THEN the code follows Clean Architecture boundaries and project standards
GIVEN generated tests and code, WHEN tests are executed, THEN the agent reports pass/fail status and coverage metrics
GIVEN the agent runs, WHEN it processes requests, THEN it uses only local Qwen model (no external APIs)
GIVEN the agent completes a task, WHEN results are reported, THEN test coverage meets ≥80% threshold
out_of_scope: Cloud-based LLM services (must use local Qwen only)
Performance/load testing (focus on functional tests only)
Integration with external CI/CD systems (local execution only)

technical_metrics: Test generation success rate: ≥90% of test cases should be valid pytest code
Code generation quality: ≥80% of generated code should pass type checking (mypy strict)
Test execution success: ≥95% of generated tests should execute without syntax errors
Coverage target: Generated tests should achieve ≥80% code coverage for target modules
Response time: Agent should complete test generation within 30 seconds per file
customer_estimates: To be provided by customer via explicit chat request

constraints: Must use existing Clean Architecture structure (domain, application, infrastructure, presentation layers)
Must integrate with existing LLM client infrastructure (Qwen model only)
Must follow project code standards: PEP 8, type hints required, docstrings required
Must maintain ≥80% test coverage for generated code
Must work entirely on local infrastructure (no external API calls)
Must respect existing layer boundaries (no cross-layer violations)
Must use pytest framework (existing project standard)
